abstract: Jordan Spieth wins Masters golf tournament, achieving his first major and tying 18-under-par record set by Tiger Woods in 1997; becomes second-youngest player ever to win tournament, behind only Woods, at age 21; stunning, level-headed performance wins hearts of spectators and highlights Spieth as emerging star among field crowded with young talents.
lead_paragraph: Spieth, who at 21 was younger than four of the seven amateurs in this year’s Masters field, became the first wire-to-wire winner at the event since 1976.

headline.main: In Record Fashion, Jordan Spieth Captures the Masters’ Green Jacket
headline.print_headline: In Record Fashion, a 21-Year-Old Captures Golf’s Green Jacket

snippet: Spieth, who at 21 was younger than four of the seven amateurs in this year’s Masters field, became the first wire-to-wire winner at the event since 1976.
